docs.title: TEF Oral Docs
docs.description: This folder contains the imported TEF materials.

docs.title: TEF Canada — Grammar Patterns for Section A Questions
docs.description: This document lists the main grammar structures used in the questions from topicsquestionsby_category.md. For each category I summarize the recurring grammar points, give short explanations and present example question templates you can reuse during practice.

previous.title: TEF Canada — Standard Questions Quick Reference

docs.title: TEF Canada: Section A Playbook
docs.description: This document provides a strategic guide for successfully completing Section A of the TEF Canada Expression Orale exam. It contains a framework for structuring your conversation, key techniques to improve your performance, and a bank of ready-to-use questions for common topics.

previous.title: TEF Canada — Verbs and Conjugations (key tenses)

next.title: Section A Playbook — TEF Canada (Practical Guide)

docs.title: Section B — Essential Grammar Structures
docs.description: This file covers the most important grammar structures used in Section B discussions. Master these patterns to speak naturally, persuasively, and grammatically correct.

next.title: Section B Playbook — Complete Strategic Guide

docs.title: Section B Playbook — Complete Strategic Guide
Section B — Complete Topic List
docs.description: This file contains all Section B topics extracted from TEF-CANADA-Expression-Oral.md. Each topic is structured as a presentation followed by suggested counter-arguments and objections students might encounter.

previous.title: Section A Playbook — TEF Canada (Practical Guide)

docs.title: Section B — Essential Verbs & Conjugations
docs.description: This reference contains the most important verbs for Section B discussions, conjugated across all necessary tenses for expressing arguments, objections, preferences, and persuasion.

previous.title: Section B Playbook — Complete Strategic Guide

docs.title: Section B — Essential Vocabulary & Translations
docs.description: This file contains key vocabulary from all Section B topics, organized by category. Use this reference to understand topic concepts and build arguments during your 10-minute discussions.
